Front: What are the EXACT auto-swap configuration steps for Azure App Service deployment slots?
Back:
1. Configure during slot creation or in deployment settings
2. Enable Auto-Swap to automatically swap staging slot to production after deployment completion
3. Zero-downtime deployment with automatic warm-up process
4. Fail-safe rollback if deployment health checks fail
5. Perfect for CI/CD integration with automated pipelines

Front: In VNet + SQL Database security configuration, what is the CORRECT sequence to avoid connectivity loss?
Back:
**C→A→D→B→E Sequence:**
**C** - VNet Integration (connect App Service to VNet subnet first)
**A** - Service Endpoint (enable Microsoft.Sql on subnet)
**D** - Firewall rules (update SQL DB to allow subnet access)
**B** - Disable public access (turn off internet access to SQL DB)
**E** - Test connectivity (verify end-to-end connection)

**Critical:** Must establish VNet integration and service endpoints BEFORE disabling public access

Front: What is the complete Container Security Pipeline implementation for ACR?
Back:
**Three-Layer Approach:**
1. **Microsoft Defender for Containers** - Detection & reporting (native vulnerability scanning)
2. **ACR Tasks** - Automated scanning in CI/CD pipeline (shift-left security)
3. **Azure Policy** - Governance & enforcement (deny unscanned/vulnerable images)

**Result:** Only approved, secure images reach production

**Why this combo works:** Defender scans, ACR Tasks automates, Policy enforces

Front: Azure Container Instances (ACI) scaling limitation vs AKS?
Back:
**ACI Limitation:** NO in-place auto-scaling

**Scaling Process:**
1. Delete existing container group
2. Modify resource specs (CPU/memory)
3. Redeploy with new configuration

**ACI vs AKS:**
• ACI = Delete/redeploy (brief downtime)
• AKS = In-place HPA (zero downtime)

**Mnemonic:** ACI = "A Container, Immutable"

Front: What are Fault Domains (FD) vs Update Domains (UD) in Azure?
Back:
**Fault Domains (FD):**
• Hardware isolation (rack, power, network switch)
• VMs in same FD can fail together
• Max 3 FDs in most regions

**Update Domains (UD):**
• Maintenance isolation (planned updates)
• Only one UD updated at a time
• Up to 20 UDs (default 5)

**Key:** FD = Hardware failure protection, UD = Maintenance isolation

Front: VMSS Orchestration Modes - Uniform vs Flexible comparison?
Back:
**Uniform Mode:**
• Identical VMs (same size/config)
• Up to 5 FDs (Platform Managed)
• Required Load Balancer for auto-scaling
• Automatic scale-in policy
• Best for: Stateless apps, web tiers

**Flexible Mode:**
• Mixed VM sizes & types allowed
• Up to 1000 FDs (Max Spreading)
• Optional Load Balancer
• Manual instance selection
• Best for: Stateful apps, databases

Front: D-G-W-C sequence for encrypted VM migration?
Back:
**"Don't Go Without Coffee"**

**D** - Deallocate (stop VM, release compute)
**G** - Create target resource Group
**W** - Wait for deletion (az vm wait --deleted)
**C** - reCreate VM with encrypted disk

**Critical:** Portal move fails for encrypted VMs
**Mandatory:** az vm wait --deleted prevents "resource in use" errors

Front: What App Service runtime constraints exist between Windows and Linux plans?
Back:
**Windows Only:** ASP.NET, .NET Framework
**Linux Only:** Ruby, Docker Multi-Container
**Both:** .NET Core, Node.js, PHP, Python, Java

**Critical:** Cannot run .NET Framework (Windows) and Ruby (Linux) in same App Service Plan

**Multiple Apps:** All apps in plan share CPU/memory and must match plan OS

Front: Container Apps ingress configuration options?
Back:
**External Ingress:**
• Internet traffic with public FQDN
• Format: app.kindcliff-123.eastus.azurecontainerapps.io

**Internal Ingress:**
• VNet only access - no internet

**Disabled:**
• No HTTP ingress

**Key Settings:**
• Target Port: Must match container listen port
• Traffic Splitting: Blue/green deployments

Front: Network Watcher Agent deployment methods?
Back:
**VM Extension:**
• Windows: Microsoft.Azure.NetworkWatcher.NetworkWatcherAgentWindows
• Linux: Microsoft.Azure.NetworkWatcher.NetworkWatcherAgentLinux

**Deployment:**
• Portal: VM → Extensions + Applications → Add NetworkWatcherAgent
• CLI: az vm extension set --name NetworkWatcherAgentLinux
• Auto-Install: When packet capture initiated

**Uses:** Packet capture, network diagnostics, troubleshooting

Front: Azure Disk Encryption (ADE) end-to-end flow?
Back:
**6-Step Process:**
1. Create VM (Portal/CLI/PowerShell)
2. Create Key Vault with -EnabledForDiskEncryption
3. Enable ADE via PowerShell (Set-AzVmDiskEncryptionExtension)
4. Disks encrypted (BitLocker/DM-Crypt)
5. Disable/Decrypt via ARM template if needed
6. Manual vs ARM template management interaction

**Key:** ARM templates can override manual settings

Front: VM sizes and series - when to use which?
Back:
**General Purpose (D, B, Av2):** Balanced CPU/memory, web apps, dev/test
**Compute Optimized (F):** High CPU ratio, app servers, batch processing
**Memory Optimized (E, M):** High RAM, databases, in-memory analytics
**Storage Optimized (L):** High IOPS, big data, NoSQL databases
**GPU (N):** AI/ML, graphics rendering
**HPC (H):** Scientific computing, simulations

**B-series:** Burstable performance for variable workloads

Front: Azure Backup vs Azure Site Recovery differences?
Back:
**Azure Backup:**
• Agentless VM backup service
• File, disk, and full VM restore
• Point-in-time recovery
• Uses Recovery Services Vault

**Azure Site Recovery (ASR):**
• VM replication for disaster recovery
• Failover to another region/on-prem
• Business continuity focus
• Orchestrated failover/failback

Front: VM disk types and caching strategies?
Back:
**Disk Types:**
• Standard HDD: Dev/test, backup (high latency)
• Standard SSD: Better latency, web/light apps
• Premium SSD: Production, databases, high IOPS
• Ultra Disk: Top-tier, SAP HANA, dynamic performance

**Caching:**
• OS Disk: Read/Write
• Data Disk: None/ReadOnly/ReadWrite (ReadOnly best for SQL data)
• Temp Disk: Ephemeral, lost on deallocate/resize/host failure

Front: App Service Plan scaling - Scale Up vs Scale Out?
Back:
**Scale Up (Vertical):**
• Change Pricing Tier/SKU (B1→S1, P1V2→P2V2)
• More power per instance (CPU, memory, disk)
• Causes application restarts

**Scale Out (Horizontal):**
• Change instance count
• Add/remove VM instances
• No downtime for existing instances
• Manual or automatic (autoscale)

**Key:** You scale the PLAN, not individual apps

Front: Deployment slot configuration and slot settings?
Back:
**Slot Settings (Environment-specific):**
• Mark as "Deployment slot setting" to prevent swapping
• Connection strings (different DBs for staging/prod)
• App settings (environment variables, API keys)
• Maintains environment isolation

**Swap Process:**
• Deploy to staging slot
• Test thoroughly
• Swap staging↔production
• Old production moves to staging (rollback ready)

**Availability:** Standard, Premium, Isolated tiers only

Front: VM network interface (NIC) configuration rules?
Back:
**NIC Rules:**
• VM needs ≥1 NIC to connect to VNet
• Primary NIC: Cannot delete without deleting VM, has default gateway
• Secondary NICs: VM size-dependent, for network appliances

**IP Addressing:**
• Private IP: Dynamic (default) or Static (recommended for servers)
• Public IP: Basic or Standard SKU, Dynamic/Static assignment

**NSG Association:** Can attach to NICs or subnets

Front: Azure Monitor vs Application Insights vs Log Analytics?
Back:
**Azure Monitor:**
• Platform metrics (CPU, memory, network)
• Resource logs via Diagnostic Settings
• Alerts based on metrics/logs

**Application Insights:**
• Deep application performance monitoring (APM)
• Tracks requests, dependencies, exceptions
• Requires code instrumentation

**Log Analytics:**
• Centralized log storage and querying
• KQL (Kusto Query Language)
• Workspace for multiple data sources

Front: Container Apps vs ACI vs AKS vs App Service comparison?
Back:
**Container Apps:** Microservices, serverless, auto-scale to zero
**ACI:** Simple containers, batch jobs, minimal management
**AKS:** Complex orchestration, enterprise, full Kubernetes
**App Service:** Web apps/APIs (PaaS), managed platform

**Scaling:**
• Container Apps: Auto (including scale-to-zero)
• ACI: Manual scaling only
• AKS: Advanced (HPA, VPA, KEDA)
• App Service: Auto & manual

Front: Custom domain and SSL certificate options in App Service?
Back:
**Custom Domain Setup:**
• DNS configuration: CNAME for www, A record for root/apex
• awverify TXT record for validation

**SSL/TLS Certificates:**
• App Service Managed: Free, auto-renewed (non-apex domains)
• Upload Your Own: PFX from CA or Key Vault
• SNI SSL vs IP SSL bindings

**DNS Records:**
• CNAME: www.domain.com → app.azurewebsites.net
• A Record: domain.com → App Service IP

Front: VM state control - Start vs Stop vs Deallocate?
Back:
**Start:**
• Powers on VM
• Compute charges apply
• Ready for connections

**Stop (OS Shutdown):**
• OS shutdown only
• Compute still charged
• VM allocated to host

**Stop (Deallocate):**
• Releases CPU/memory
• Compute charges stop
• Storage charges continue
• Public IP may change (if dynamic)

Front: Azure autoscale rules and best practices?
Back:
**Triggers:**
• CPU Percentage: Scale out >70%, scale in <30%
• Memory Percentage: Available on newer VM generations
• Network In/Out: Bandwidth utilization
• Queue Metrics: Service Bus, Storage Queue depth
• Schedule-based: Business hours, predictable patterns

**Best Practices:**
• Cool-down period: 5+ minutes between operations
• Avoid scale thrashing
• Set appropriate min/max limits

Front: VNet Integration vs Private Endpoints differences?
Back:
**VNet Integration:**
• Outbound connectivity FROM App Service
• Access VMs, PaaS services in VNet
• Regional - same region required
• Requires dedicated subnet (/28 or larger)
• Non-transitive across peerings

**Private Endpoints:**
• Inbound connectivity TO App Service
• Private IP within VNet
• No public internet exposure
• Provides private access to your app

Front: ARM template vs Bicep vs Terraform differences?
Back:
**ARM Templates:**
• Declarative JSON
• Native Azure, idempotent
• Foundation for IaC in Azure

**Bicep:**
• Simpler DSL (Domain Specific Language)
• Transpiles to ARM JSON
• Azure-specific, cleaner syntax

**Terraform:**
• Multi-cloud IaC
• HCL syntax
• State management required

**Key:** All achieve Infrastructure as Code

Front: Azure Storage account types and use cases?
Back:
**General Purpose v2 (GPv2):**
• Recommended for most scenarios
• Supports all storage services
• Hot, Cool, Archive tiers

**Premium:**
• Page blobs only (VM disks)
• High IOPS, low latency

**General Purpose v1 (GPv1):**
• Legacy, classic deployment model
• Limited features vs GPv2

**FileStorage:**
• Premium file shares only
• High-performance workloads

Front: Blob lifecycle management policy examples?
Back:
**Common Patterns:**
• Hot → Cool after 30 days of no access
• Cool → Archive after 90 days in Cool
• Delete blobs after 365 days
• Move snapshots to Archive after 90 days

**Use Cases:**
• Cost optimization for aging data
• Compliance requirements
• Automated data management
• Log retention policies

Front: Azure Files vs Azure File Sync differences?
Back:
**Azure Files:**
• Fully managed file shares
• SMB and NFS protocols
• Cloud-native storage
• Direct cloud access

**Azure File Sync:**
• Hybrid file storage solution
• Sync on-premises Windows Server with Azure Files
• Cloud tiering capabilities
• Centralized management

**Use Case:** File Sync for hybrid scenarios with on-premises caching
